markdown:
_Note: this is a technical documentation website. Commercial landing page is located here [https://metaapi.cloud](https://metaapi.cloud/)_

_Note to reader: We aimed to create a powerful yet simple API. If you'll find a missing feature you need, please drop us a message via online chat._

MetaStats API is a member of MetaApi project ([https://metaapi.cloud](https://metaapi.cloud/)), a powerful cloud forex trading API which supports both MetaTrader 4 and MetaTrader 5 platforms.

MetaStats is a fast, cost-efficient, easy to use and standards-driven cloud forex trading statistics API supporting both MetaTrader 4 and MetaTrader 5 platforms designed to boost forex application development process.

Using MetaStats API you can develop applications similar to Myfxbook or MetriX extremely fast, saving time you otherwise spend for coding, optimizing and testing your own trading metrics calculation engine, since we already did it for you.

## Pricing[#](#pricing "Permanent link")

MetaStats is available to all MetaApi users without extra charges at this point.

You pay only an affordable fee for MetaApi MetaTrader terminal hosting. See [https://metaapi.cloud/#pricing](https://metaapi.cloud/#pricing) for more details.

MetaApi provides a free tier for testing and personal use so that you can test our APIs without any charges.

## Features[#](#features "Permanent link")

Features supported:

*   support for MetaTrader 4 and MetaTrader 5 platforms
*   metrics calculation for MetaTrader accounts added to MetaApi
*   optionally include open positions in metrics calculation
*   retrieve trades with gain, trade duration and pips metrics
*   retrieve open trades with gain, trade duration and pips metrics

The features described above are available for use via a professional, fast, easy to use, standards-driven REST API which can be easily consumed from any programming language.

The primary intended use of MetaStats API is creating trade monitoring applications.

## SDKs[#](#sdks "Permanent link")

Official SDKs are listed on [https://metaapi.cloud/sdks](https://metaapi.cloud/sdks) page. Please check readme files of corresponding packages for SDK docs.

## Documentation structure[#](#documentation-structure "Permanent link")

*   the `REST API` section describes how to interact with the MetaStats using the RESTful API
*   the `Models` section describes the response schemas that the application uses to communicate with the client

See our website for the full list of APIs and features supported [https://metaapi.cloud/#features](https://metaapi.cloud/#features)

Some of the APIs you might decide to use together with MetaStats API are:

1.  MetaApi cloud forex trading API [https://metaapi.cloud/docs/client/](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/client/)
2.  CopyFactory copy trading API [https://metaapi.cloud/docs/copyfactory/](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/copyfactory/)
3.  MetaTrader account management API [https://metaapi.cloud/docs/provisioning/](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/provisioning/)
4.  MetaApi MT Manager API [https://metaapi.cloud/docs/manager/](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/manager/)
5.  MetaApi risk management API [https://metaapi.cloud/docs/risk-management/](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/risk-management/)

## FAQ[#](#faq "Permanent link")

## Is API implementation stable?[#](#is-api-implementation-stable "Permanent link")

We released MetaStats in the end of Jan 2021. We beleive it is ready for production use.

## How can I be sure your service is reliable enough?[#](#how-can-i-be-sure-your-service-is-reliable-enough "Permanent link")

We implemented a comprehensive test suite for this API. We execute them before each release.

## Can I test your API without coding any app?[#](#can-i-test-your-api-without-coding-any-app "Permanent link")

Yes, please check the swagger UI for MetaStats API: [https://metastats-api-v1.new-york.agiliumtrade.ai/swagger/](https://metastats-api-v1.new-york.agiliumtrade.ai/swagger/)

## Could you explain what all metrics mean in REST API response?[#](#could-you-explain-what-all-metrics-mean-in-rest-api-response "Permanent link")

Please check this document for description of all metrics present in REST API response: [Metrics model](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/metrics/)

## Will I be charged for using your API?[#](#will-i-be-charged-for-using-your-api "Permanent link")

The MetaStats API relies on a paid MetaApi service. See [https://metaapi.cloud/#pricing](https://metaapi.cloud/#pricing) for more details. A free usage tier is available.

## I would like to try the API for free, is this possible?[#](#i-would-like-to-try-the-api-for-free-is-this-possible "Permanent link")

MetaApi provides a free usage tier for testing and personal use.

## I plan to run many accounts at once. Can I get a discount?[#](#i-plan-to-run-many-accounts-at-once-can-i-get-a-discount "Permanent link")

We designed our pricing so that you pay equal or less than amount you have to pay for executing your own infrastructure even in high volume usage scenario. Please check our [pricing](https://metaapi.cloud/#pricing).

## Is the service safe to use?[#](#is-the-service-safe-to-use "Permanent link")

Security of our service is mostly based on the fact that it is not possible to transfer funds from your trading account using trading terminal access, because access to deposits/withdrawals is split from trading access by your broker. Our app requires only trading terminal access to operate correctly. Feel free to do your own research on this subject if you want.

When you add your trading account to our app via MetaApi, you expose your MT account password (so that our app can connect to your broker) and your API calls to our app.

In our company we employ standard industry security protocols. The application code is being reviewed by senior management before going into production. The cloud infrastructure runs on an isolated network and all ingoing and outgoing communication is encrypted and uses strong authentication. The number of people who have access to production infrastructure is limited to a single person who administers the infrastructure and resolve technical issues if they arise.

## How do you recommend to secure my account?[#](#how-do-you-recommend-to-secure-my-account "Permanent link")

We recommend you to add your MT accounts to MetaApi using investor (read-only) password if possible. This approach should work fine for most trade monitoring apps using MetaStats API, since they do not need to execute trades.

## I'm getting 404 NotFound or 401 UnauthorizedError error when I'm trying to access my account via API, what might be wrong?[#](#im-getting-404-notfound-or-401-unauthorizederror-error-when-im-trying-to-access-my-account-via-api-what-might-be-wrong "Permanent link")

Please make sure that the URL you use to access your account matches the region account is deployed at. You can find region-specific URL on [API access page](https://app.metaapi.cloud/token).

## Other questions[#](#other-questions "Permanent link")

Any question? Post it via online chat any time to get a response. We will be happy to answer.

## REST API[#](#rest-api "Permanent link")

MetaStats is a professional, fast, easy to use, standards-driven REST API which can be easily consumed from any programming language.

This section describes how to interact with the MetaStats API.

## Documentation structure[#](#documentation-structure "Permanent link")

Requests to MetaStats using the REST API can be synchronous (the server sends a response only after completion) or asynchronous (the server sends a 202 status code indicating that it is calculating metrics and you can retrieve them at a later time). Each section below contains a description of the request, request parameters, and possible responses. There are also examples of requests and responses.

## Testing the API[#](#testing-the-api "Permanent link")

You can use [Swagger documentation](https://metastats-api-v1.new-york.agiliumtrade.ai/swagger/#!/default) in order to test the REST API. It explains each feature of the MetaStats REST API and allows you to invoke the API via web UI.

## Calculate metrics[#](#calculate-metrics "Permanent link")

## About[#](#about "Permanent link")

Calculates and returns a MetaApi account metrics. This API call is billable

`GET /users/current/accounts/:accountId/metrics`

For more information see [swagger documentation](https://metastats-api-v1.new-york.agiliumtrade.ai/swagger/#!/default/get_users_current_accounts_accountId_metrics). Note, that this URL is valid for new-york region only. You can find URLs for other regions on [API access page](https://app.metaapi.cloud/token).

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| auth-token | string | Yes | MetaApi account token. See [Authentication & authorization](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/restApi/auth/) |

### Path parameters[#](#path-parameters "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| accountId | string | Yes | MetaApi account id |

### Query parameters[#](#query-parameters "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| includeOpenPositions | boolean |     | indicates inclusion of open positions in the calculation |

## Response[#](#response "Permanent link")

Responses:

*   200 - metrics for a specified MetaTrader account returned successfully. Response schema: {metrics: [Metrics](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/metrics/)}
*   202 - metrics for the specified MetaTrader account in processing. Response schema: {status: string, message: string}. Response headers: {"retry-after": integer} - interval in seconds to retry
*   401 - Authorization failed due to auth-token invalid. Response schema: [Error](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/error/)
*   403 - MetaStats API is not enabled on provided trading account. Response schema: [Error](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/error/)
*   500 - Failed to calculate metrics for a specified MetaApi account. Response schema: [Error](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/error/)

### Examples[#](#examples "Permanent link")

Example request:

`curl -X GET --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --header 'Accept: application/json' --header 'auth-token: token' 'https://metastats-api-v1.new-york.agiliumtrade.ai/users/current/accounts/865d3a4d-3803-486d-bdf3-a85679d9fad2/metrics'`

## About[#](#about "Permanent link")

Returns historical trades with specific time range for MetaApi account.

`GET /users/current/accounts/:accountId/historical-trades/:startTime/:endTime`

For more information see [swagger documentation](https://metastats-api-v1.new-york.agiliumtrade.ai/swagger/#!/default/get_users_current_accounts_accountId_historical-trades_startTime_endTime). Note, that this URL is valid for new-york region only. You can find URLs for other regions on [API access page](https://app.metaapi.cloud/token).

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| auth-token | string | Yes | MetaApi account token. See [Authentication & authorization](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/restApi/auth/) |

### Path parameters[#](#path-parameters "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| accountId | string | Yes | MetaApi account id |
| startTime | string | Yes | start of time range, inclusive, in broker timezone, in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format |
| endTime | strinf | Yes | end of time range, exclusive, in broker timezone, in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format |

### Query parameters[#](#query-parameters "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| limit | integer |     | pagination limit, default: 1000, min: 1, max: 1000 |
| offset | integer |     | pagination offset, default: 0, min: 0 |
| updateHistory | boolean |     | update historical trades before returning results |

## Response[#](#response "Permanent link")

Responses:

*   200 - Historical trades with requested time range for a specified MetaTrader account returned successfully. Response schema: {trades: [Array](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/trade/)}
*   202 - metrics for the specified MetaTrader account in processing. Response schema: {status: string, message: string}. Response headers: {"retry-after": integer} - interval in seconds to retry
*   401 - Authorization failed due to auth-token invalid. Response schema: [Error](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/error/)
*   403 - MetaStats API is not enabled on provided trading account. Response schema: [Error](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/error/)
*   404 - MetaTrader account not found or not provisioned yet. Response schema: [Error](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/error/)

### Examples[#](#examples "Permanent link")

Example request:

`curl -X GET --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --header 'Accept: application/json' --header 'auth-token: token' 'https://metastats-api-v1.new-york.agiliumtrade.ai/users/current/accounts/865d3a4d-3803-486d-bdf3-a85679d9fad2/historical-trades/2020-09-08%2022:21:36.000/2020-09-09%2022:21:36.000'`

Example synchronous response: \`\`\`json { "trades": \[ { "\_id": "865d3a4d-3803-486d-bdf3-a85679d9fad2+1", "accountId": "865d3a4d-3803-486d-bdf3-a85679d9fad2", "positionId": "1", "volume": 1, "durationInMinutes": 16, "profit": 3.01, "gain": 106, "success": "won", "openTime": "2020-09-08 22:21:36.000", "type": "DEAL\_TYPE\_BUY", "symbol": "EURUSD", "closeTime": "2020-09-08 24:37:36.000", "openPrice": 1.1835, "closePrice": 1.1935, "pips": 100 } \] }

## Read open trades[#](#read-open-trades "Permanent link")

## About[#](#about "Permanent link")

Returns open trades for MetaApi account. This API call is not billable

`GET /users/current/accounts/:accountId/open-trades`

For more information see [swagger documentation](https://metastats-api-v1.new-york.agiliumtrade.ai/swagger/#!/default/get_users_current_accounts_accountId_open_trades). Note, that this URL is valid for new-york region only. You can find URLs for other regions on [API access page](https://app.metaapi.cloud/token).

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| auth-token | string | Yes | MetaApi account token. See [Authentication & authorization](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/restApi/auth/) |

### Path parameters[#](#path-parameters "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| accountId | string | Yes | MetaApi account id |

## Response[#](#response "Permanent link")

Responses:

*   200 - Open trades for a specified MetaTrader account returned successfully. Response schema: {trades: [Array](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/openTrade/)}
*   401 - Authorization failed due to auth-token invalid. Response schema: [Error](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/error/)
*   403 - MetaStats API is not enabled on provided trading account. Response schema: [Error](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/error/)
*   404 - MetaTrader account not found or not provisioned yet. Response schema: [Error](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/error/)

### Examples[#](#examples "Permanent link")

Example request:

`curl -X GET --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --header 'Accept: application/json' --header 'auth-token: token' 'https://metastats-api-v1.new-york.agiliumtrade.ai/users/current/accounts/865d3a4d-3803-486d-bdf3-a85679d9fad2/open-trades'`

Example synchronous response: \`\`\`json { "openTrades": \[ { "\_id": "865d3a4d-3803-486d-bdf3-a85679d9fad2c+1040", "accountId": "865d3a4d-3803-486d-bdf3-a85679d9fad2", "positionId": "1040", "volume": 1, "profit": 0.12, "success": "won", "openTime": "2021-10-15 20:34:54.000", "type": "POSITION\_TYPE\_BUY", "symbol": "EURUSD", "openPrice": 1.1835, "durationInMinutes": 1215, "gain": 0.04003202562049639, "pips": 11 } \] }

In order to invoke MetaStats REST API you have to provide an authorization token via auth-token header. An API request will produce error 401 if for some reason the token specified in auth-token header turned out to be invalid and the authorization failed.

The token can be retrieved via MetaApi [Web application](https://app.metaapi.cloud/token).

## About[#](#about "Permanent link")

Profitability from trading a currency pair on long and short positions in [one trading day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day)

### Fields[#](#fields "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| date | string(date) | Yes | date of [trading day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day), in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD format |
| totalProfit | number | Yes | the value of the total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) at the end of the [trading day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| totalPips | number |     | the value of the total [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) at the end of the [trading day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| shortProfit | number |     | total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) of [short trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/short.asp) per [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| longProfit | number |     | total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) of [long trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/long.asp) per [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| shortPips | number |     | total [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) of [short trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/short.asp) per [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| longPips | number |     | total [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) of [long trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/long.asp) per [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |

### Example[#](#example "Permanent link")

`{   "date": "2019-06-16",   "totalProfit": 265,   "totalPips": 2832,   "shortProfit": 100,   "longProfit": 165,   "shortPips": 832,   "longPips": 2000 }`

## Currency summary metrics[#](#currency-summary-metrics "Permanent link")

## About[#](#about "Permanent link")

Provides statistics on winning and losing trades indicating the amount in the context of long and short positions. Statistics is given for all currency pairs, for which positions were opened. For more information [(read more)](https://www.investopedia.com/financial-edge/0412/the-basics-of-currency-trading.aspx)

### Fields[#](#fields "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| currency | string | Yes | trading [currency pair](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/currencypair.asp) |
| history | [Array<CurrencySummaryHistoryDayMetrics>](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/currencySummaryHistoryDayMetrics/) | Yes | currency trading history by [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| total | [CurrencySummaryTotalMetrics](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/currencySummaryTotalMetrics/) | Yes | total currency trading data |
| short | [CurrencySummaryTradeMetrics](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/currencySummaryTradeMetrics/) |     | data on [short trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/short.asp) in this currency |
| long | [CurrencySummaryTradeMetrics](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/currencySummaryTradeMetrics/) |     | data on [long trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/long.asp) in this currency |

### Example[#](#example "Permanent link")

`{   "currency": "EURUSD",   "long": {     "profit": 849,     "trades": 1   },   "short": {     "profit": -80.3,     "trades": 1   },   "total": {     "lostTradesPercent": 50,     "wonTradesPercent": 50,     "profit": 768.7,     "trades": 2,     "wonTrades": 1,     "lostTrades": 1   },   "history": [     {       "shortProfit": -80.3,       "totalProfit": -80.3,       "date": "2020-12-15"     },     {       "longProfit": 849,       "shortProfit": -80.3,       "totalProfit": 768.7,       "date": "2020-12-18"     }   ] }`

## Daily growth metrics[#](#daily-growth-metrics "Permanent link")

## About[#](#about "Permanent link")

[Daily growth](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/g/growthrates.asp) shows the profitability of the trading account. It shows each profit received from the volume of trade and changes in balance, total accumulated income and existing account drawdown [by day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day).

### Fields[#](#fields "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| date | string(date) | Yes | date of [trading day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day), in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD format |
| profit | number |     | cumulative [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) per [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| pips | number |     | cumulative [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) per [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| lots | number |     | cumulative [lots](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/standard-lot.asp) per [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| gains | number |     | cumulative [percentage gains](https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/how-do-you-calculate-percentage-gain-or-loss-investment/) per [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |
| totalProfit | number | Yes | total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) in this [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) end |
| totalGains | number | Yes | total [percentage gains](https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/how-do-you-calculate-percentage-gain-or-loss-investment/) in this [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) end |
| balance | number | Yes | [balance](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/accountbalance.asp) in this [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) end |
| drawdownPercentage | number |     | percentage of [balance drawdown](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/d/drawdown.asp) in this [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) end |
| drawdownProfit | number |     | maximum registered [balance drawdown](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/d/drawdown.asp) in basic currency during this [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day) |

### Example[#](#example "Permanent link")

`{   "date": "2018-02-23",   "profit": -100,   "pips": -1057,   "lots": 1.5,   "gains": -1.5,   "totalProfit": 230,   "totalGains": 76,   "balance": 176087,   "drawdownPercentage": 17,   "drawdownProfit": 10655 }`

### Fields[#](#fields "Permanent link")

## Too many requests error[#](#too-many-requests-error "Permanent link")

## About[#](#about "Permanent link")

Contains a too many requests error message and data. The error occurs if more requests are made within a certain period than the application allows. The HTTP response contains the Retry-After header, which indicates when it is recommended to repeat the request for its successful completion. See more [Rate limiting](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/models/restApi/rateLimiting.md)

### Fields[#](#fields "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| id  | integer | Yes | Error id |
| error | string | Yes | Error name |
| message | string | Yes | Error description |
| metadata | object | Yes | Additional information about error. See below |

#### Metadata[#](#metadata "Permanent link")

| Name | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| periodInMinutes | integer | Yes | rate limiting period in minutes |
| requestsPerPeriodAllowed | integer | Yes | available requests for period |
| recommendedRetryTime | string(datetime) | Yes | recommended time to retry request |

### Example[#](#example "Permanent link")

`{   "id": 1,   "error": "TooManyRequestsError",   "message": "The /users/current/accounts/99e5dbbc-f9d5-4482-b613-6cf328c5eb2e/metrics API allows 25 requests per 1 minutes to avoid overloading our servers. Please wait some time and retry your request or contact support to extend your quota.",   "metadata": {     "periodInMinutes": 1,     "requestsPerPeriodAllowed": 25,     "recommendedRetryTime": "2021-02-05T16:59:17.029Z"   } }`

## Usages[#](#usages "Permanent link")

All responses of [REST API](https://metaapi.cloud/docs/metastats/restApi/api/calculateMetrics/)
